name: Four Points by Sheraton Toronto Mississauga

reviews.text: We drove down to Mississauga from Montreal for business and got in a day early (Feb. 7) due to the impending snowstorm. Although our reservation was only for the 8th, I had called the hotel to make sure there would be room for us a night early. We had 3 nights booked under a corporate rate (75$/night) and then ended up having to pay the full price for the early night ($150+tx) I didn't mind if it meant not having to drive during the snow storm. The hotel itself is clean and simple. There's a lobby bar/ restaurant that was very convenient, especially when it seemed the entire city shut down on the 8th because of the snow. We had the rejuvn8 burgers one night, very filling. Another night we shared the nacho plate, wasn't bad. We shared the bruschetta with a bottle of wine another time, also not bad at all.
reviews.title: Good business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rejuvn8 restaurant became our home while the snow crippled the city. Our first night there was a hoot, some drunk lady started complaining about mold in the vents, but she was clearly very, very intoxicated. The staff handled it like pros, and all the patrons in the restaurant had a good laugh about it. Ordering drinks with a side of mold.... (There was no mold btw, clearly she was someone trying to get comped for her alcohol...)
reviews.title: Great Stopover

reviews.text: The room itself was a bit small, but more than adequate. The bed was comfortable and so were the pillows. Always a bonus when staying away from home.
reviews.title: Nice but stay away from the adjoining rooms!

reviews.text: We never tried the pool, although it was empty most of the time.
reviews.title: Comfortable for short stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a few restaurants in the area, but the options are limited. Some expensive steak restaurant, a seafood restaurant, a burger king...
reviews.title: Great staff and clean room

reviews.text: Booked one room with two queens and stayed with another couple. The room was very spacious, clean and the beds were very comfortable. If I ever another wedding to go to in the area I will definitely book this hotel.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: I stayed here for business and first noted the recently rennovated bar. They did an awesome job with the bar. There are cozy booths to gather for business and have a drink. THe halls did have a stale smell, but that didn't transfer into the rooms. The beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was acceptable. Would recommend for business. They have a very small pool that may not satisfy most kids.
reviews.title: Great room and Bar

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night as it was very good value ($69) on Air Canada's Vacation scheme for a stopover in the middle of connecting flights (although bizarrely they don't credit Aeropolan points). The staff were very helpful and welcoming and the room was very well appointed, nicely set out and very comfortable bed. The only negative point was that the air conditioning in the room was very noisy. If you catch the complimentary shuttle from the Airport ring them first to see when it's next due - it runs only every 40 minutes or so. Be aware that there are three Four Points at Toronto Airport. This one is about 20 minutes drive and is a bit remote. It's fine with the shuttle and just as a stopover though.
reviews.title: A/C Noisy, Bit Remote But Well Appointed

reviews.text: Visited Toronto end of August for a wedding; spent 3 nights at this Sheraton hotel, through a deal on hotwire. It was a nice comfortable stay; although most time was spent outdoors.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at the Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: NOT CLOSE TO AIRPORT

reviews.text: We got a really good rate at this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised...room appeared to be recently renovated; very modern, wood looking tile and coat rack in entry way, bathroom with wall dispensers of shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Large room with long counter top along the wall, mini fridge, coffee machine and free bottle of water. Free wifi and parking were very welcome and the free parking especially almost unheard of. Restaurant in hotel served a nice range, a little expensive but good food. Only negative about the very nice room for me was that it was a little dark, the pillows were too soft and the heater compressor made a lot of noise every time it turned on.
reviews.title: All positive except for shuttle service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the negative..until this point, would have definitely returned to this hotel however we waited
reviews.title: Great Place to Spend a Layover

reviews.text: 1 hour and 13 minutes for the shuttle on a freezing cold Sunday afternoon. When we first called from the airport we were told the shuttle was already there. 15 minutes later with no shuttle we thought perhaps we had missed it. Called the hotel and receptionist said he is leaving now and will be there in 15 minutes. Another 45 minutes later he arrived and said he had to wait for another customer whose flight was arriving in 5 minutes! We were frozen, upset at the continuing delay and the fact that whilst we had been made to wait 1 hour and 13 minutes, we should be asked to wait perhaps another 30 minutes for the customer whose plane had still to arrive - let alone wait for his luggage or go through customs/immigration! At this point I did lose my temper whereupon the shuttle driver gave me his phone to speak to the receptionist...I explained my dissatisfaction and requested we be transported immediately which they finally agreed to do. While waiting for this shuttle, all the other hotel shuttles had passed by at least twice..including the Days Inn bus - a hotel which is several layers below Sheraton yet seems to offer punctual shuttle service. The shuttle to the airport the next morning left on time. As I mentioned earlier, but for this experience I would definitely have returned to this hotel but very likely will not...unless I read newer reviews that mentioning positive shuttle reviews.
reviews.title: Environmentally Friendly!!!!

reviews.text: Our circumstances are probably different from 99% of travelers to Toronto. We used 'wood points to get this room for free to use during our 13 hour layover in Toronto before flying to Santiago, Chile later that night (we had a good reason for doing this rather than checking out Toronto). We landed at 10:30am or so and were able to call the hotel from the Information phone in the baggage claim area. Be aware that there are more than one Four Points by Sheraton near the airport, so you need to specify the one on Dixie Road. Anyway, a shuttle came to pick us up from the airport within 10 minutes. On the map, it looks closer to the airport, but it was probably 10 minutes to drive from pick-up to the hotel.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: We had contacted the hotel ahead of time to ask for an early check-in time - fortunately, they were able to accomodate us by checking us in at 11am...and we got a complimentary upgrade to the King Junior Suite! We relaxed and recovered from a long work week in their very comfy bed and spacious room for the entire day.
reviews.title: Good Location - Not good rooms for business

reviews.text: We got a room for free there through the Air Canada Stopover program. Since our flight arrived in Toronto at 5:35 am, sounded like a good idea to get a room, take a shower, and get ready to go visit our daughter and family before they would get up.
reviews.title: OK for the price. A bit out of the way, even from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In many ways, the hotel was better than what we had expected, especially for a free room. Shower was nice, room looked OK.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel , Food terrible

reviews.text: Only down side, location. They are way back compared to the airport. Takes a long time, first for te shuttle to show up, then to get there. Then when you order a cab the front desk guy gets a pal of himself from the same tribe, not an official Toronto cab, to take you downtown. Charges $60, which might well be the going rate, given that the place is actually further away than the airport. But takes no credit card and takes forever to show up.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Hi I stayed at this hotel November 30th, and December 1, 2012. The room was average. The bed was extremely comfortable. Upon check in I told the guest service agent I didn't want to stay in a specific room because it's the same room they gave me last time. The room is in front of the elevator and ice machine. So, you don't get much quiet. The agent would not give me a new room! Luckily it wasn't extremely noisey. I was just disappointed the agent refused to give me a new room. Anyhow, I ordered wings from room service. It arrived in about 20 minutes. The food was not freshly prepared, it was cold, and overcooked. It was not eatable. On the second day I left the room early and went shopping. When I came back my room was being cleaned. So I went and waited in the main lobby. I was eating my lunch. I was told that I wasn't allowed to eat in the main lobby. I could understand if the food was messy, or had a strong odor, but it wasn't. This was my 5th visit to this hotel. Not sure I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Disappointing for a Sheraton Hotel!

reviews.text: conditions and design of the hotel was good, cleanliness is maintained. the condition of the rooms ia also satisfy, the pool and the gym were small but well maintained. location passable. free parking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel close to the airport

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Toronto Mississauga Hotel
description: Four Points by Sheraton Toronto Mississauga is located near Pearson International Airport, Congress Centre, Canada's Wonderland, and CN Tower. We also provide 5,000 sq ft of event space.
